intro: Nassauvia nivalis, commonly known as the snowbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10 to 20 centimeters. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in fine, silky hairs. Nassauvia nivalis thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings.
